Jark

blog code group

why jark
start

scripting

resources
wishlist
git log
 A tool to manage classpaths and clojure namespaces on a persistent JVM

Emacs support

To start the swank server do jark swank start. The same can be added to ~/.jarkrc
We can connect from emacs: M-x slime-connect 127.0.0.1 4005

Vim support

To start the vim server do the following. 

$ jark vim start
=>  Starting VimClojure server on port 2443 ...
    NGServer started on all interfaces, port 2443.
    Installing vim nailgun server ..
    Loading dependencies ...
    file:/home/ambrose/.cljr/lib/clojure-1.2.0.jar
    file:/home/ambrose/.cljr/lib/clojure-contrib-1.2.0.jar
    file:/home/ambrose/.cljr/lib/server-2.2.0.jar
    Successfully started VimClojure server on port 2443
defaults to port 2443. Takes a —port option.

To list classpath:

$ jark vim cp [--port]

To add a jar or directory to the classpath:

$ jark vim cp [--port] something.jar

Add the following to .vimrc

:let vimclojure#WantNailgun = 1
:let vimclojure#NailgunPort = 2443

To shut the vim server down:

$ jark vim stop --port 2443

The above vim module is contributed by Ambrose Bonnaire-Sergeant
